channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Japan Stocks Fall Sharply After Weak U.S. Jobs Data, Yen Strengthening
item.description: The Nikkei Stock Average was trading down around 8% on Monday afternoon after falling 5.8% on Friday.

item.title: Chevron earnings miss on lower refining margins, relocates headquarters to Houston
item.description: The results come as the Chevron-Hess deal is delayed until well into 2025 due to an arbitration case with ExxonMobil.

item.title: Mars in Advanced Talks to Buy Cheez-It, Eggo Maker Kellanova
item.description: The deal would be one of the largest of the year and could come together imminently.

item.title: Tech stocks see steepest three-week slump in two years, led by plunge in Amazon and Intel
item.description: With quarterly earnings largely in the rearview mirror, Wall Street is troubled by what it's seeing out of Silicon Valley.

item.title: Stock Funds Are Up 12.6% in 2024
item.description: It was another positive month for stock funds, but bond funds are drawing big-time cash. Also: A flashback to the 20th anniversary of the Google IPO.

item.title: DraftKings to tax winning bets in high-rate states in a bid to boost profit
item.description: DraftKings will implement a gaming tax on winning bets in some states where the tax rate is highest, including Illinois, New York, Pennsylvania and Vermont.

item.title: In Investing, Does It Pay to Follow the Money?
item.description: Fund investors can gain an edge by following net buying and selling in a given month, but such data lose their predictive value the next month, this professor writes.

item.title: Berkshire's mounting cash pile could top $200 billion as Buffett continues selling stock
item.description: The Omaha-based conglomerate's cash hoard is likely to exceed its previous record of $189 billion when it reports quarterly earnings Saturday.

item.title: 2024's Most Popular Trades Are Unraveling
item.description: Some on Wall Street worry the Fed waited too long to cut rates.

item.title: Linde extends its streak of earnings beats, flexes ability to handle any economy
item.description: The industrial gas supplier continues to deliver earnings growth in an "industrial recession" over the past several quarters.
